result.execSummary:
The defendant James J. Cummings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Sign releases so agent can monitor for counseling and assessments.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James J. Cummings

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.

9:47 a.m. Defendant James J. Cummings in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Plea to count 1 and to be dismissed and read in count 2
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 Battery-Domestic.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court request W/H Sentence 18 month probation. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint agreement in part and requests  I/S Sentence 12 month probation.  

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION****
Count 1 Battery-Domestic Abuse:
I/S Sentence: 75 days jail stayed: 18 months Probation
Conditions:
10 days conditional jail w/Huber, no credit.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Sign releases so agent can monitor for counseling and assessments.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge + including Domestic Abuse surcharge.
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James J. Cummings in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on behalf of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:  Bond and Conditions of bond are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

1:23 p.m.  Court calls case 
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct and Domestic Abuse.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant is employed with Clean Power.
State requests a signature bond of $2,000.00  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   March 16, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
